intro: Zwingera orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco zwingera, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas near rivers. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
